item.title: NBA 2K25: Best Dunk Styles
item.description:
There isn't anything quite like a successful dunk in the NBA, and there really isn't anything like pulling one off in a game of NBA 2K25 . Being able to drive into the paint, leap over an opponent, and slam the ball down through the hoop is something that sends a message to the opponent: they're not stopping it . It's a way to flex over the other team and get the crowd into the game like no other play can.

The game does a great job of making dunking feel just as satisfying as it would be in a real game. It also offers a ton of different animations and styles for dunking that players can use to choose how they want to pull off this iconic move. This guide is here to inform anyone who wants to choose the best options about just what those options are.

Athletic Front Tomahawks

Slam It With Authority

  • An aggressive dunk that makes a statement
  • Can be tough to block

A Tomahawk jam is one of the best kinds of dunks in the game of basketball. It involves the player cocking their arm back with the ball as they take off and then dunking it with authority. It's an aggressive dunk that can demotivate an opponent easily. It's also pretty tough to block thanks to how quickly it happens.

Cradle Dunks Off One

Safe And Effective

  • Has some attitude to it, but isn't careless.
  • A controlled dunk to ensure a score.

This dunk can be just about perfect . It has the player cradling the ball to stop a defender from poking it or blocking it, while finishing with a pretty stylish slam. For players who want to show off a little bit but don't want to risk losing out on the points , this dunk animation is for them. It makes the entire experience much more exciting, as you can relax about it being stopped.

LeBron James

An Iconic Dunk

  • LeBron's dunks are fearsome and electric.
  • The range is incredible.

LeBron has built much of his legacy on how powerful his dunks are and this animation makes players feel like they're actually controlling the GOAT (it's a joke, Jordan fans). This animation will get the crowd, and probably the player, on their feet .

Quick Drops Off Two

Don't Worry About Missing

  • The safest option to score
  • Simple, but effective

This makes the list thanks to its safety; this dunk is not meant to be flashy or boastful . It is about putting the ball through the basket as safely and quickly as possible. When players attempt a more elaborate dunk, they run the risk of having that dunk blocked or defended by an opponent. This animation is designed to stop that from happening .

Russell Westbrook

An Athletic Flair

  • It's quick and easy.
  • Explosiveness makes it fun.

Westbrook is not the biggest player in the league, but he has made a name for himself through his athleticism and explosive plays . He has always been able to barrel his way in for a layup, and sometimes a big dunk. Pulling this one off isn't as easy, as it requires a good lane to the hoop. But once it is done, it can electrify a game immediately.

item.title: The First Descendant: Best Shotguns, Ranked
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • The First Descendant blends the looter shooter and RPG genres, complete with a cash shop and optional season pass.
  • Shotguns in the game, like Fireworks or The Last Knight, offer varying damage, crit chance, and fire rates, catering to different playstyles.
  • Ultimate-tier shotguns like Smithereens and Executor have higher damage and unique stats but require effort to unlock through blueprints and research.

The First Descendant mixes several genres into a unified whole. It is part looter shooter and part role-playing game. It operates as a live service game, and of course, has a cash shop. There is also an optional season pass available, which gives better rewards to subscribers.

As with most first-person shooters, there is a full range of weapon categories in The First Descendant , including shotguns. These are high-damage, slow-rate-of-fire weapons that do the most damage at close range. Unfortunately, there is little to differentiate the different shotguns in this game, with several having considerable overlap. But then again, a shotgun is a pretty basic weapon in the real world, so this is somewhat understandable.

6 Fireworks

Low Damage And Low Crit

  • Tier : Rare
  • DPS : 254
  • Rounds : 12
  • Fire rate : 67
  • Critical rate : 1%
  • Critical damage modifier : 1.15
  • Reload speed : 1.61 seconds

Fireworks is a pretty lackluster shotgun in The First Descendant , but it marks the boundary between shotguns that are useful and shotguns that are useless. Being the lowest entry doesn’t mean it is awful. It's capable but nothing special. For players who want to focus on a high-power build in The First Descendan t, Fireworks is pretty easy to get and better than any standard weapon.

This shotgun should be pretty easy to loot. It drops with a 50% chance in the Classified Area in Sterile Land for completing the Unknown Laboratory. It is likely that for many players, Fireworks will be the easiest of the better shotguns to get hold of early in the game.

5 The Last Knight

High Crit Chance

  • Tier : Rare
  • DPS : 272
  • Rounds : 9
  • Fire rate : 120
  • Critical rate : 3%
  • Critical damage modifier : 1.2
  • Reload speed : 1.69 seconds

The Last Knight isn’t just a very cool-looking shotgun in The First Descendant , it is also a pretty capable one. Sure, it doesn’t compare to either of the two ultimate-tier shotguns, but it is much easier to acquire. But with its higher crit chance, it could be the basis of a shotgun build until the player can unlock one of the two top-tier shotguns.

As with most rare weapons in The First Descendant , The Last Knight can be farmed. Players should head to the Grand Square area of Kingston, and complete the Suspicious Battery Pack. There is a 50% chance of The Last Knight dropping.

4 In A Blink

Can Be Farmed Quite Easily

  • Tier : Rare
  • DPS : 400
  • Rounds : 8
  • Fire rate : 75
  • Critical rate : 2%
  • Critical damage modifier : 1.2
  • Reload speed : 1.54 seconds

In a Blink is an excellent shotgun, and as with all shotguns, it uses High Powered Rounds as ammo. What makes this shotgun a compelling choice is that it is fairly simple to create a high DPS build around this weapon by trying to max out the Firearm ATK, Weak Point Damage, Bonus Firearm ATK, and Weapon Change Speed stats.

Another reason to look closely at In A Blink is the fact that it can actually be farmed. Players can head to the Lost Supply Depot area of Vesper, and complete the Sepulcher. In A Blink drops with around a 50% chance.

3 Subconsciousness

Highest Raw Damage Shotgun

  • Tier : Rare
  • DPS : 412
  • Rounds : 10
  • Fire rate : 120
  • Critical rate : 2%
  • Critical damage modifier : 1.2
  • Reload speed : 1.45 seconds

Subconsciousness is everything a good shotgun should be. With very high damage but very close range, it is a weapon that needs to be used up close and personal in The First Descendant . For players who cannot yet gain access to either of the two best, ultimate shotguns, then Subconsciousness is a good choice.

Subconsciousness can be farmed at a 50% drop rate, which is good news. Players should head to the Convertor Facility area of Fortress and complete the Central Control Unit. This weapon is the perfect rare shotgun to begin putting together a high-power build around, based on the player's class and skills, and then upgrading to an ultimate-tier shotgun when possible.

2 Executor

Toss Up For Top Place

  • Tier : Ultimate
  • DPS : 282
  • Rounds : 15
  • Fire rate : 109
  • Critical rate : 1%
  • Critical damage modifier : 1.1
  • Reload speed : 1.85 seconds

It was tough to decide where to put Executor on this list. Both of the ultimate-tier shotguns could have taken the top spot. However, the Executor misses out on the top spot simply because Smithereens fits the shotgun weapon archetype more closely. But at the end of the day, it will be down to the player to decide which they prefer.

Unlocking this weapon in The First Descendant is somewhat complicated. It involves getting hold of the blueprint through intercept battles or looting it in hard mode in certain regions. Once the player has the blueprint, they need to find all of the research materials and research it.

1 Smithereens

Top Pick For A Shotgun

  • Tier : Ultimate
  • DPS : 292
  • Rounds : 10
  • Fire rate : 150
  • Critical rate : 1%
  • Critical damage modifier : 1.1
  • Reload speed : 1.6 seconds

Smithereens took the top place over the Executor because it has higher damage and a better fire rate. However, as already mentioned, both of these last two shotguns from The First Descendant could have taken the top spot.

Unlocking this weapon is going to take some effort, as it uses the same mechanics as all ultimate weapons do. Namely looting the blueprint and then researching it. But for a high-power build, this is the endgame weapon, unless the player prefers the slightly different stats of the Executor.

item.title: Pokemon GO Player That's Been Playing Since 2016 Reaches Incredible Milestone
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • A Pokemon GO player reached level 50 without spending much money, a rare accomplishment.
  • Dynamax feature is being integrated, adding new Pokemon forms for players to enjoy.
  • Many players are hesitant to reveal how much money they spent on the game, with some avoiding microtransactions.

A Pokemon GO player who has been playing the game since 2016 has achieved an incredible milestone of reaching level 50, all while barely spending any money in the game. Reaching level 50 in Pokemon GO is an arduous task since it involves a huge XP grind for the final few levels, which often requires players to take part in several events.

It's turning out to be an eventful season for Pokemon GO fans, with the long-awaited Dynamax feature arriving in the game. Niantic has been actively releasing new Dynamax forms of Pokemon in Pokemon GO , and it seems like the feature will quickly become an integral part of the game. There are plenty of paid and free events planned for the Max Out season, offering players new Pokemon, rewards, and much more. Amid that, a player has made a commendable accomplishment in Pokemon GO .

In a new post on the Pokemon GO subreddit, user AkashVK18_ highlights an incredible achievement. They shared a picture of their level-up screen upon reaching level 50 in Pokemon GO and added that they have been playing the game since 2016, the game's launch year. However, what's more impressive is the fact that they "almost never put any money in the game," as noted in their post. One of the biggest hurdles players face while leveling up is the XP requirement, which compels them to resort to microtransactions. For the record, just leveling up from level 49 to 50 requires a whopping 30 million XP.

Pokemon GO Fans Are Reluctant to Reveal Their In-Game Expenditure

The player also asked other players in the community how much they had spent in the game so far, and many were quite reluctant to reveal the exact amount. In fact, there seems to be a common consensus in the community that one should never ask a Pokemon GO player how much they have spent in the game, as they are often not proud of it. Many players noted that they had barely spent any money in Pokemon GO before 2020, but their expenditure in-game seems to have risen dramatically in the past few years. One player even hyperbolically stated that they have spent so much that Niantic should consult them before rolling out updates.

On the flip side, there are quite a few players who seem to be careful about their expenditures in-game and stated that they only spent money on a backpack upgrade or big event tickets, such as the GO Fest in Pokemon GO . The biggest issue for players who don't want to spend money is managing the storage in Pokemon GO , since players need to buy Item Bag upgrades from time to time to increase the number of items they can hold.

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Current Banner, Next Banner, And Past Banners
item.description:
Quick Links

  • ZZZ Current Banners - Zenless Zone Zero
  • ZZZ Next Banners - Zenless Zone Zero
  • ZZZ Upcoming Banners - Zenless Zone Zero
  • ZZZ Banner History - Zenless Zone Zero

The banners in Zenless Zone Zero are called Signal Search, and it's split into four parts; Exclusive Channel, W-Engine Channel, Stable Channel (Star-Studded Cast), and Bangboo Channel. Exclusive Channel is the banner that features a limited S-Rank Agent, while the W-Engine is where players can get the signature weapon for the featured 5-star character. Meanwhile, Stable Channel and Bangboo Channel are standard banners in ZZZ , where the former contains S-Rank Agents and W-Engines, whereas the latter is exclusively for 4-star and 5-star Bangboos.

Players can get standard banner characters from the limited banner if they lose their 50/50 chance, so there are multiple ways to get Stable Channel characters. Proxies can also pick a character of their choice if they pull a total of 300 Signal Search in the Star-Studded Cast. Since the standard banners don't change, players may be interested in knowing the current, next, and past banners in the ZZZ limited banner instead. For that, you can check out this article for everything you want to know about Zenless Zone Zero limited Signal Search.

ZZZ Current Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

The Exclusive Channel on ZZZ currently features Caesar (Physical-Defense) from the Sons of Calydon faction. Her banner comes with the following A-Rank Agents:

  1. Piper (Physical-Anomaly) - Sons of Calydon faction
  2. Anton (Electric-Attack) - Belobog Industries faction

Version 1.2: September 25, 2024 – October 16, 2024 (Phase 1)

Caesar Featured Banner - Debut

Tusks of Fury W-Engine Banner

ZZZ Next Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

The next banners for ZZZ 1.2 are Caesar (phase 1) and Burnice (phase 2).

Version 1.2

Burnice

Caesar

ZZZ Upcoming Banners - Zenless Zone Zero

Zenless Zone Zero 1.3 teased two new upcoming characters, Yanagi and Lighter .

Version 1.3

Yanagi

Lighter

ZZZ Banner History - Zenless Zone Zero

Here's a full banner history in ZZZ :

Version 1.1: September 4, 2024 – September 24, 2024 (Phase 2)

Jane Doe Featured Banner - Debut

Sharpened Stinger W-Engine Banner

Version 1.1: August 14, 2024 – September 4, 2024 (Phase 1)

Qingyi Featured Banner - Debut

Ice-Jade Teapot W-Engine Banner

Version 1.0: July 24, 2024 – August 13, 2024 (Phase 2)

Zhu Yuan Featured Banner - Debut

Riot Suppressor Mark VI W-Engine Banner

Version 1.0: July 4, 2024 – July 24, 2024 (Phase 1)

Ellen Featured Banner - Debut

Deep Sea Visitor W-Engine Banner

item.title: Zenless Zone Zero: Caesar Guide (Best Build, Weapon, Drive Disc, & Skills)
item.description:
With the 1.2 update in Zenless Zone Zero , players will be introduced to more of the Sons of Calydon faction, which was initially showcased through characters like Piper and Lucy. This faction is further expanded with the introduction of two new limited S-rank Agents: Caesar and Burnice. While synergy is a key factor in team building in ZZZ, Caesar stands out due to her unique role as the first S-Rank Defense unit, making her highly adaptable to a wide variety of team compositions.

However, Caesar offers more than just defensive capabilities. Her kit allows her not only to mitigate damage for the team but also to function as a hybrid stunner, especially with her Impact stat. This means she can both defend and contribute to crowd control. To maximize Caesar's potential, here’s a guide on how to build her for optimal performance, ensuring she becomes an excellent and versatile unit in players' Zenless Zone Zero roster.

Caesar Build In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

W-Engine

Drive Discs

Drive Discs Stat

  1. Tusks of Fury
  2. Original Transmorpher
  3. Any (S-rank) Stun Engine with Impact stat
  4. Spring Embrace

4-piece set:

  • Proto Punk
  • Freedom Blues (Anomaly Teams)

2-piece set:

  • Shockstar Disco
  • Swing Jazz
  • Fanged Metal

  • 4 slot: Crit Rate / Crit DMG
  • 5 slot: Physical DMG%/ ATK%/ Pen
  • 6 slot: Impact
  • Sub-stat priority: Crit Rate / Crit DMG, ATK% PEN, ATK

Caesar Skills, Explained - Zenless Zone Zero

Despite being classified as a Defense character , Caesar typically fills the role of a Stun character rather than a traditional support due to her scaling with the Impact stat. Her abilities focus on generating shields for the entire team based on this stat, while also providing a degree of anti-interrupt protection. Caesar excels at building Daze value with her Special EX attacks and defensive assists , making her a powerful hybrid unit. Additionally, her kit allows for easier perfect blocks, and with the right setup, her defensive assists can apply a debuff to all enemies within a small radius. This debuff increases enemy damage taken by 25% for 30 seconds in a 7m radius , which can drastically boost the team's overall DPS output.

Her shield mechanic is also distinct from other Defense characters. Not only is it party-wide, but while the shield is active, Caesar grants a 1,000 ATK buff to the entire team. This combination of offense and defense makes her an ideal hybrid unit. Caesar's gameplay is relatively straightforward, centered around her Special ATK combos and defensive assist abilities, allowing her to mitigate damage, stun enemies, and boost team damage output all at once. This makes her a versatile and easy-to-use unit in many team compositions.

Caesar Best W-Engines In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

Unsurprisingly, Tusk of Fury stands out as the best W-Engine for Caesar, given that it is her signature option. This W-Engine not only increases Caesar's shielding value, making her even more effective in sustaining the team, but it also enhances the entire team's DMG and Daze dealt whenever a perfect dodge or interrupt is triggered by any team member. As the only S-Rank Defense W-Engine currently available, it is an excellent choice for all existing defense-oriented units, as its utility isn't limited by specific stats like Impact, ATK, or HP.

For alternative options, players may want to consider Ben's signature option , Original Transmorpher , which increases both Impact and HP —since Impact in particular benefits Caesar's playstyle. Surprisingly, the next best options are generally Stun W-Engines , as they offer valuable Impact stat increases. The existing S-Rank Stun W-Engines will all generally perform better than lower-tier alternatives.

Lastly, players might consider the BP option , Spring Embrace , though its stats aren't as synergistic or impactful as the previously mentioned choices for Caesar despite being a Defense W-Engine.

Caesar Best Drive Discs In ZZZ - Zenless Zone Zero

Unfortunately, players won't be able to pre-farm for Caesar's best 4-piece Drive Disc set upon her initial release, as the 1.2 version update introduces two new Drive Disc sets: Proto Punk and Chaos Jazz. Of these, the 4-piece Proto Punk set is Caesar's best option. This set not only enhances her shield effect, but its 4-piece bonus synergizes perfectly with her kit, boosting all squad members' DMG by 15% when a Defensive Assist or Evasive Assist is triggered by any team member.

For players using Caesar in teams with anomaly units like Jane, the Freedom Blues set can also be effective. In this case, building Anomaly Mastery on Caesar is necessary, though Proto Punk remains the best all-around option for most teams.

For 2-piece options, Shockstar Disco is the most beneficial, as it increases Impact by 6%, a crucial stat for Caesar. If players don’t have ideal pieces for Shockstar Disco, they could consider Swing Jazz or Fanged Metal as alternatives on a short term.

In terms of stats, players should prioritize Crit Rate/ DMG on her 4-slot (or Anomaly Proficiency if using an anomaly team), Physical DMG , ATK% , or PEN on her 5-slot and lastly Impact on her 6-slot, as this is Caesar's most important stat, which cannot appear as a sub-stat.

For sub-stats , focus on Crit Rate/Crit DMG , ATK% , PEN , and ATK . While having perfect sub-stats is beneficial, Caesar's performance will not be drastically affected by less-than-optimal rolls, especially since the set effects or main stats will be generally more useful in her case.
